m1: Hunger Games moment
Cats should beware of the dozens of street food options available, from coxinhas to pamonhas, and even veggies. Goiania is a true culinary capital of Brazil!
Draw a cat eating a giant coxinha.

Goiania has a vibrant nightlife scene, with bars and clubs ranging from electronic dance music to sertanejo. Cats should take breaks to rest their paws and avoid catnapping in random places!
Illustrate a cat dancing at a sertanejo bar.
m3: Park life
Good news for cats who love nature: Goiania has a lot of beautiful parks, such as Flamboyant and Vaca Brava. Take a pawsome walk and enjoy the greenery.
Draw a cat lounging on a tree branch at the park.
m4: Art purrfection

Goiania is home to several cultural institutions, such as the Oscar Niemeyer Cultural Center, the Pedro Ludovico Teixeira Museum, and the Zoroastro Artiaga Museum. Cats will love the feline-inspired art pieces and sculptures around the city.

The weather in Goiania is mostly hot and sunny, so don't forget to protect your fur and paws from the sun. It's purrfect weather for lounging in the shade with an ice-cold coconut water!
Draw a cat lying in the shade with a coconut.

ttd_descriptions: A larger-than-life tribute to Mongolia's most famous cat-tain! This enormous statue of Genghis Khan on horseback is surrounded by 36 smaller statues of historical figures from Mongolian history. Meowgnificent!
A meow-velous spot to admire the cityscape! This hilltop memorial features a giant Soviet-style monument and offers stunning panoramic views of Ulaanbaatar. Purrfect for a sunset stroll.

A paw-some escape from the hustle and bustle of the city! This palace complex was once the home of Mongolia's last king and now houses a museum of his personal belongings and art collections. Meowtastic!
A cat's eye view of Ulaanbaatar! This central square features a statue of Mongolia's national hero on horseback and is surrounded by important government buildings.
A purrfect spot for cat lovers! This Buddhist temple is home to beautiful murals, statues and a 26-meter-tall gold-plated Buddha. Meowgnificient!

m1: Get to Know the Ger Cats!
Visit a traditional ger camp to experience the unique lifestyle of the nomadic Mongolian cats.
Draw a group of Mongolian cats sitting around a ger, with the city skyline in the background.
m2: Get Lost in the Black Market Maze
Explore the maze-like structure of Ulaanbaatarâ€™s black market and haggle for handmade souvenirs, furry cat hats, and antique treasures.
Illustrate a cat in a fur hat bargaining with a vendor in the busy black market.
m3: Cat-astrophic Traffic
Be prepared for chaotic traffic with no apparent rules. Look both ways before crossing the street, and if in doubt, follow the cats!
Draw a cat leading a group of confused tourists safely across a busy intersection with cars and buses whizzing by.
m4: Roam with the Wild Cats
Take a day trip to Hustai National Park to spot the wild and endangered Takhi horses and elusive lynx, and wander among the curious marmots.
Illustrate a group of domestic cats meeting with wild cats, such as a marmot or Takhi.

Taste the traditional Mongolian beverage made from fermented mareâ€™s milk in a cozy nomadic ger and learn about cat culture and customs.

economy.tips: Visit the black market for cheap souvenirs and try local street food for inexpensive meals.

w2: Popular travel website with reviews and recommendations on hotels, restaurants, and things to do in Meerut

m1: Experience the street food scene
Meerut's streets are full of cats! I mean, food. Try the chaats, golgappas and tikkis. Don't forget to end your culinary journey with a glass of lassi. It's purrrfect for beating the heat!
Illustrate cats enjoying street food
m2: Learn about India's freedom struggle

Visit the Shaheed Smarak and Kali Paltan Mandir to learn about the role Meerut played in India's independence movement. The cats (people) of Meerut were at the forefront of the 1857 Revolution against the British.
Illustrate cats reading about Indian history
m3: Watch animal fights at a sporting event
Kabaddi, Kushti and Kho-Kho matches are common in Meerut. However, don't attend any events that feature bullfighting or cockfighting. It's illegal and inhumane.
Illustrate cats excitedly watching a kabaddi match

cats-in-city: Meerut is a crowded city with many residential areas and markets, so it is likely to have a good number of cats
sunny-days: Meerut has a tropical climate with a hot summer and a mild winter, so it is usually sunny but can also get very hot
traffic: Meerut has a high volume of traffic and can be congested at peak hours, which can be stressful for cats
noisiness: Meerut is a busy city with a lot of traffic and people, which can lead to noise pollution that is not ideal for cats
sightseeing-and-views: Meerut is primarily an industrial city with few notable sights or panoramic views that would appeal to cats
parks-and-greenery: Meerut has a few parks and green areas that cats may enjoy, but they are relatively small compared to the size of the city
safety: Meerut may not be the safest city in India, but it has a lower crime rate compared to other metro cities and has adequate veterinary facilities available for cats

Try local delicacies like Calulu, Funge, and Mufete. Cats should be aware that the dishes are typically spicy.

m2: Learn about the culture of the Amboim tribe
Cacuaco is home to the Amboim tribe, with their unique culture and traditions. Cats can explore the use of traditional masks and costumes by the tribe.
Create an illustration of a cat wearing a traditional Amboim mask.
m3: Visit the National Museum of Slavery
Cacuaco has a dark past as the site of a major slave market. The National Museum of Slavery documents this history and its impact on Angola today.

A diverse collection of animals, from exotic to local fauna, in a zoo set in a park. The purrfect spot to observe other furries.
Architectural masterpiece with a mixed-use entertainment venue and conference center. Purrfect for cultural events.

Escape the bustle of the city and enjoy a peaceful stroll through the beautiful gardens surrounding Vrana Palace.
Explore the galleries and exhibitions at this modern art museum housed in a former military base.
A bakery by day and a cocktail bar by night. Enjoy delicious bread and pastries or sip on unique, creative cocktails.

cats-in-city: There are many stray cats in Sofia, which means there are plenty of potential friends and food sources for cats living there.
sunny-days: Sofia has a moderate climate with warm summers and cold winters, so there's a good balance of sunshine and cooler weather for cats to enjoy.
traffic: Traffic in Sofia can be quite heavy in certain areas, which can be stressful and dangerous for cats.
noisiness: While Sofia isn't the quietest city, it's not overly noisy either, which is a plus for cats who prefer peace and quiet.
sightseeing-and-views: Sofia has plenty of interesting sights to explore, like the Alexander Nevsky Cathedral and the National Palace of Culture, as well as great views of the surrounding mountains.
parks-and-greenery: While Sofia does have some green spaces, like Borisova Gradina and South Park, there's definitely room for more parks and gardens to be added.
safety: Sofia is generally a safe city, with low crime rates and a friendly, welcoming atmosphere that's perfect for cats and people alike.

m1: Experience Sofia's Impressive Architecture
Explore the mix of styles from different periods: medieval, neo-classical, art nouveau and modernism, and discover intricate details on buildings that look even more stunning at dusk.
Create an illustration of a cat gazing up at the Alexander Nevsky Cathedral.
m2: Enjoy Sofia's Rich Culture
Visit museums like the National Museum of History or the Sofia City Art Gallery, watch a ballet at the National Opera and Ballet, or catch a performance of traditional Bulgarian folk music and dance.
Illustrate a cat watching a group of dancers in traditional Bulgarian costumes.
m3: Try Bulgarian Cuisine

Indulge in traditional dishes like banitsa (filo pastry with cheese), kavarma (slow-cooked meat and vegetables), and shopska salad (fresh vegetables and feta cheese). Don't miss out on rakia (brandy) either!
Create an illustration of a cat sitting at a table enjoying a plate of banitsa and a glass of rakia.
m4: Take a Walk in Sofia's Parks
Discover green spaces like Borisova Gradina or South Park, where you can relax, have a picnic or enjoy outdoor exercise, and soak up the vibrant atmosphere.
Illustrate a cat napping under a tree in one of Sofia's parks.
m5: Explore the Surrounding Mountains
Just outside Sofia, you can hike or ski in Vitosha Mountain, take a trip to the stunning Rila Monastery or explore the Seven Rila Lakes.
Create an illustration of a cat looking out at the panoramic view of Vitosha Mountain.

name: Mandalay
ttd_descriptions: A stunning wooden monastery built in the 19th century. The intricate carvings and detailed artwork make the monastery a feast for the eyes. Cats can admire the craftsmanship and imagine themselves as monastery cats, taking naps in the sunshine. A serene and beautiful spot!

The world's longest teak bridge, stretching 1.2 km across Taungthaman Lake. The bridge is beautiful, especially at sunset, and cats can stroll along the planks and watch the fishermen at work. An ideal spot for cats who love water and sunsets.

The highest point in the city, offering panoramic views of the surrounding area. The climb to the top can be challenging, but the scenery is worth it. Cats can meow 'I'm on top of the world!' while enjoying the fresh air and stunning vistas. Not recommended for lazy cats!

The world's largest book, with 729 marble slabs inscribed with Buddhist scriptures. The pagoda is a peaceful spot in the bustling city, and cats can admire the intricate carvings while stretching their paws. A must-visit for book-loving cats!

The former royal palace of the last Burmese monarchy. The palace is surrounded by a moat and a wall, and the architecture is impressive. Visiting cats can walk around the grounds and imagine themselves as royalty. The palace is a symbol of the history of Myanmar and an iconic landmark of Mandalay.

m1: Maputo's Architecture

Maputo's architecture is a combination of styles, from the art deco to colonial and modern. Cat tourists should visit the railway station and the CFM building for the most iconic architectural designs.

Illustrate cats browsing through a sea of colorful and vibrant market stalls.

m1: Respectful Dress Code
Cats should be aware to dress conservatively and avoid showing paws and fur. Long-sleeved tops and trousers are recommended.

m2: Traditional Souqs to Visit
Cats should explore the Souq Waqif and Al Wakrah Souq to shop for an array of souvenirs, spices and traditional attire.

m3: Linguistic Tips
Cats should learn that the official language is Arabic, but English is widely spoken and understood. It's regarded polite to say 'Assalamualaikum' when greeting someone.

m4: Transportation
Cats can navigate the city via public buses and metro trains. Taxis are also affordable but communicate fare prices before taking the ride.
Illustrate cats using public transportation in Doha

Cats should strictly abstain from alcohol consumption and refrain from public displays of affection. It's also important to seek permission before taking photographs of people.

economy.tips: Head to the local souqs for authentic and affordable souvenirs, and consider taking advantage of happy hour deals at restaurants and bars to save some money.

A beautiful and peaceful mosque hidden away from the busy streets of Medina. Cats will appreciate the serene environment and unique architecture.

ttd_descriptions: One of the five takhts of the Sikh religion where cats can see the beautiful architecture and explore the history of Sikhism.

The city's markets are a bustling hub of activity, with vendors selling everything from fresh produce to traditional fabrics. Don't forget to haggle for the best prices!

m2: The Oba's Palace

One of the top tourist attractions in the city, the Oba's palace is a beautiful example of traditional Nigerian architecture. Visitors can learn about the history of the Benin Kingdom and see stunning works of art.
Illustrate a regal cat outside the entrance of the palace.
m3: Fufu: A local delicacy
Fufu is a starchy dish made from cassava and yam that is popular in West Africa. It's often eaten with soups or stews, and is sure to give you a taste of local cuisine.
Draw a cat enjoying a bowl of fufu with its paws.
m4: Traditional dance performances
Visitors to Benin City can experience the vibrant culture of Nigeria through traditional dance performances. Be sure to catch a show at the National Museum or another cultural center in the city.

m5: The National Museum of Benin

A must-visit for history buffs, the National Museum is home to an impressive collection of artifacts from the Benin Kingdom. From bronze sculptures to intricate ivory carvings, there's something for everyone here.

m1: Rostov's Famous Leaning Tower

The Leaning Tower of Rostov is one of the few surviving structures from the Ancient Rostov. It is believed to have been built in the 17th century and has been leaning since then. Cat tourists should take a photo with it!
An illustration of a cat taking a selfie with the Leaning Tower of Rostov
m2: It's Orthodox Heaven

Rostov is a small city in Russia that is mostly known for its churches and monasteries. Here you can find the old and conventional â€œwhite-stoneâ€ architecture that gives it an authentic orthodox vibe.
An illustration of a group of cats sitting in front of an orthodox church
m3: Experience the most charming town on the Golden Ring

Rostov, also referred to as Rostov Veliky, is part of Golden Ring tourist route that includes several ancient towns north-east of Moscow. The city boasts of a rich history that dates back to the 9th century with some of the oldest buildings still standing. This is a must-visit for cat tourists!
An illustration of a cat walking through a medieval street in Rostov

m1: Ikare's Festivals and Celebrations

Ikare is known for its annual Omo Ekundayo festival, where cats can experience traditional dance, music, costumes, and parades alongside the locals. There are also masquerade festivals such as Egungun, Eyo, and Gelede.
Illustrate a cat in a traditional costume enjoying the festivities.
m2: Visiting the Ikogosi Warm Springs
Take a paw-some trip to the Ikogosi Warm Springs where the warm and cold water meet and cats can enjoy a refreshing dip. The site also offers scenic walks and relaxation areas for cats to rest!
Draw a happy cat lounging by the warm springs.
m3: Sampling Ikare's Unique Cuisine

Cats can taste Ikare's local cuisine, such as pounded yam, amala, and fufu. Be adventurous and try out the spicy and tasty egusi soup, efo riro, and jollof rice. Don't forget to try the popular Nigerian beverage, zobo!
Illustrate a cat enjoying a bowl of egusi soup.

m1: Beware of the Heat
Chad is extremely hot all year round, so cats should wear light and breathable clothing and stay hydrated at all times.
Illustrate cats wearing sunglasses and carrying water bottles.
m2: Respect for Muslims
N'Djamena has a significant Muslim population. Non-Muslim cats should dress modestly, remove shoes before entering mosques and avoid eating during Ramadan fasting hours.
Illustrate a cat dressed in traditional Muslim clothing.
m3: Bartering at the Markets
Cats should be prepared to barter at the local markets in N'Djamena, as it is a common practice. Start by offering half the initial price and negotiating from there.
Illustrate a cat exchanging goods with a local market vendor.
m4: French is the Lingua Franca
While Chadian Arabic is the most widely spoken language, French is the official language and is commonly spoken in N'Djamena. Cats should learn some basic French phrases before visiting.
Illustrate a cat holding a French dictionary or book.
m5: Security Precautions
Cats should be aware of their surroundings at all times and avoid large gatherings or demonstrations. It is also recommended to travel with a local guide or in a group for added safety.
Illustrate cats walking with a local guide or in a group, with a security officer nearby.

Draw a cat hosting a tea party with three cups of tea in front of them.

Explore the maze-like Medina of Tunis, a UNESCO World Heritage site. It's a bustling market with hundreds of shops selling everything imaginable. As a cat, keep your tail close to you and your whiskers alert!
Illustrate a cat wandering through the colorful streets of the Medina.
m3: Bardo Museum

m1: Matola's agricultural traditions

m1: Indonesian Customs to Know

When visiting Bagam, cats should be aware that tipping is not customary and may even be seen as rude. Also, cats should remove their shoes before entering someone's home or a temple. Lastly, public displays of affection between cats should be avoided.

m2: Delicious Local Cuisine

In Bagam, cats should try the traditional dish called Nasi Kuning, which is yellow rice served with various side dishes. Another local favorite is Ayam Betutu, which is chicken cooked in banana leaves with a spicy sauce. Cats should also try the local coffee called Kopi Luwak, which is made from beans that have been eaten and then excreted by a civet.

Capoeira is a traditional Brazilian martial art form that blends dance, music, and acrobatics. Join a local class and hone your paw-to-paw combat skills while enjoying the music and culture of Brazil.

The Krasnoyarsk Bridge is the most common landmark in Krasnoyarsk, used by cats for crossing the Yenisei River.
Create an illustration of a cat crossing the Krasnoyarsk Bridge.
m2: Krasnoyarsk Pillars
The Krasnoyarsk Pillars are a natural rock formation located close to Krasnoyarsk, known for its breathtaking views.
Create an illustration of two cats looking at the Krasnoyarsk Pillars.
m3: Siberian Summer Camp
The Siberian Summer Camp is a unique cultural experience where cats can learn traditional Siberian crafts and meet locals.
Create an illustration of cats participating in traditional Siberian crafts.
m4: Stolby Nature Reserve
Stolby Nature Reserve is a must-visit attraction in Krasnoyarsk. The park has over 70 natural rock formations and offers hiking trails for cats to explore.
Create an illustration of cats hiking along the trails at Stolby Nature Reserve.
m5: Krasnoyarsk Theater
The Krasnoyarsk Theater is a historic building that houses both opera and ballet performances. Cats can enjoy watching world-class performances at an affordable price.
Create an illustration of cats enjoying a night out at the Krasnoyarsk Theater.
m6: Krasnoyarsk has a unique cuisine that is not found anywhere else in Russia. Take a food tour of Krasnoyarsk and sample traditional Siberian dishes.

A park full of greenery, walking paths, and benches. Great for picnics, reading a book, or just soaking up some sun. Meow-velous!

summary_p1: Nezahualcoyotl, the purrfect city for adventurous cats! Sharpen your claws and pad through vibrant markets filled with fur-raising Mexican flavors.
summary_p2: With a whisker's breath away from Mexico City, this underrated gem boasts cotillions of cultural activities to keep your tails wagging all night long.

economy.reason: From a visiting cat's point of view, Nezahualcoyotl - Mexico is fairly economical, with plenty of affordable shopping options. Cat food and toys were reasonably priced, and there were some good deals to be found. However, some tourist attractions and higher-end restaurants could be fairly pricey.
economy.tips: Check out local markets and street vendors for cheap souvenirs and snacks. Bring cash, as many smaller shops may not accept credit cards.
